creditline: Lent by the Heirs of Louis W. Hill, Sr.
text: In this dynamic depiction of a classical myth, Theseus stands poised to impale the Minotaur, a legendary monster with the body of a man and the head of a bull.  The Minotaur (literally, the bull of Minos) was the cursed son of Pasiphae, the wife of King Minos of Crete.  The beast inhabited a labyrinth that was his hunting grounds, and until Theseus, everyone who entered was doomed to death.
title: Theseus Combatting the Minotaur
